author: Sruthi Shankar
title: Walmart worries, bond yields threaten six-day winning streak
text:
NEW YORK (Reuters) - The Dow and S&P 500 fell on Tuesday to snap a six-session winning streak as a sharp decline in Walmart ( WMT.N ) weighed heavily, but gains in Amazon ( AMZN.O ) and chip stocks helped the Nasdaq hold near the unchanged mark.
The Dow Jones Industrial Average .DJI fell 256.62 points, or 1.02 percent, to 24,962.76, the S&P 500 .SPX lost 15.98 points, or 0.58 percent, to 2,716.24 and the Nasdaq Composite .IXIC dropped 5.16 points, or 0.07 percent, to 7,234.31.
Reporting by Chuck Mikolajczak; Editing by James Dalgleish
